column2: WYOMING PERMIT TEST

1. When changing lanes, you should remember that:
column4: you should look over your left shoulder for a left lane change and your right shoulder for a right lane change.
column6: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.
column8: vehicles with two outside mirrors have no blind spots.

column6: go ahead because drivers have the right-of-way.

20. At intersections with a yield sign, you must:
column6: yield to the vehicles on your left only.
column8: yield the right-of-way to cross traffic close enough to cause conflict.

column2: 21. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: there is a right turn ahead.
column6: they must stay on the right side of the divider

column2: 22. Before passing a vehicle or changing lanes, remember to:
column4: signal your return to the left lane.
column6: sound your horn as you pass.
column8: only pass or change lanes if the change can be completed  without speeding.

column2: 23. A steady green light at intersections means:
column4: You may drive through the intersection if the road is clear

column2: 24. This road sign means:
25. Before you change lanes, you should:
column4: look for other traffic by turning your head and looking behind you for oncoming traffic.
column8: keep other vehicles out of your blind spots.

column2: 26. Where there is no bicycle lane, where on the road must a bicyclist ride?
column4: near the left edge of the road.
column6: on the left shoulder of the road.
column8: near the right curb or edge of the road.

column2: 27. This sign indicates that:
column4: trucks are merging from the right
column8: there is a steep hill ahead.

column2: 28. Who is most at risk?
column4: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 29. This road sign means:
column4: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.

column2: 30. Parking is not allowed:
column6: on the road side of a parked vehicle.

column2: 31. When riding in a vehicle equipped with air bags is, children ages 12 and under are safer:
column4: in the bed of a pick-up truck.
column6: buckled up in the front seat.
column8: buckled up in the back seat.

column2: 32. This road sign means:
33. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.
column6: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column8: you are not allowed to park here.

column2: 34. What should you do if a vehicle is approaching head-on in your lane?
column4: Pull over to the left and use your emergency lights to stop the other driver.
column6: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other driver.
column8: Turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 35. An emergency vehicle that uses lights and a siren can be unpredictable. Why?
column4: The driver can legally pass red lights.
column6: Emergency vehicle drivers are not required to be careful.
column8: Emergency vehicles must go faster than the posted speed limit when it is safe to do so.

column2: 36. This road sign means:
37. When approaching someone using a white cane or guide dog, drivers should:
column4: honk their horn as they proceed past them.
column6: stop until the person is well away from the roadway or path of travel.

column2: 38. A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
column4: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.
column6: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.
column8: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.

column2: 39. To avoid becoming an aggressive driver, you should:
column6: Adjust your schedule to drive during times with the most highway traffic.
column8: Allow enough travel time to reach your destination on schedule.

column2: 40. This road sign means:
41. Broken yellow lines:
column4: separate lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions.
column6: separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction.
column8: indicate you are in a no passing zone.

column2: 42. When a pedestrian is crossing a street guided carrying a white cane, drivers must:
column6: yield the right of way at corners only.
column8: help the pedestrian cross the street.

column2: 43. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column8: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 44. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.

column2: 45. To maintain an adequate "space cushion" to the front, drivers need to:
column4: The other answers are both correct.
column6: keep a safe distance between their car and the vehicle in front.
column8: control their speed to suit the road and traffic conditions.
